events.title: Chernobyl Nuclear Disaster
events.description: A catastrophic nuclear accident occurred at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine, then part of the Soviet Union, leading to massive radioactive contamination.
events.significance: It is considered the worst nuclear power plant accident in history, leading to widespread environmental damage and long-term health effects for thousands.

events.title: Soviet Troops Withdraw from Afghanistan
events.description: The last Soviet troops left Afghanistan after a decade-long conflict following the Soviet invasion in 1979.
events.significance: The withdrawal marked the end of the Soviet-Afghan War and had significant implications for the Cold War and regional dynamics.

events.title: Gestapo Established in Nazi Germany
events.description: The Nazi regime established the Gestapo, the secret state police, to suppress opposition and enforce Nazi policies.
events.significance: The Gestapo became a key instrument of state terror during the Nazi era, contributing to widespread human rights abuses.

events.title: Spanish Civil War: Bombing of Guernica
events.description: Although the bombing took place on April 26 under Nazi Germany's Condor Legion, it was part of the Spanish Civil War's brutal aerial attacks on civilian targets.
events.significance: The attack became a symbol of the horrors of war, immortalized by Picasso's famous painting 'Guernica.'
